description.intro: Hello! I'm Nelson, aka nelsonGX. I'm a student from Taiwan, and I do some coding and server management related stuff.
description.work: I currently own Very Fast Network LTD, a company based in Taiwan that operates CheapServer hosting services under AS152619. I also have another company called Open Company LTD that literally helps people start their own companies. Alongside these main businesses, I run FreeServer, a free hosting service community. I also manage a Minecraft server called FreeServer Network, which focuses on map sharing for creators.
description.community: I'm actively involved in tech communities, attending conferences like SITCON, HITCON, and COSCUP to learn and network with fellow enthusiasts.

javascript.confidence: Not bad, but I hate it

cheapserver.description: A hosting service for game servers based in Taiwan.

freeserverNetwork.description: A Minecraft server focusing on map sharing for creators.

serverManagement.title: aboutme.exe - server_managing
serverManagement.heading: Server Managing & Networking
serverManagement.description: I am the founder of several server hostings. I have experience in managing servers and hosting websites.

codingDevelopment.title: aboutme.exe - coding_and_development
codingDevelopment.heading: Coding & Development
codingDevelopment.description: As you can see, I do code. I have experience in Python, Java, Next.JS/React and more. In the most part, am still learning. You can find my projects on Github:

minecraft.title: aboutme.exe - minecraft
minecraft.heading: Minecraft
minecraft.description: I have been playing Minecraft for over 8 years. I have experience in creating custom plugins and stuff.
minecraft.content: Minecraft has been a big part of my journey. I've been building servers, creating plugins, and designing experiences for players. My experience spans from simple automation scripts to complex multiplayer servers with custom game mechanics.
minecraft.quote: Just like a lot of Minecraft players, I started all of these coding stuff because of Minecraft. When I was a kid and playing it, I like to play around with command blocks and redstone, and I always want to do more than that. So I started to learn programming, and... here I am!

techStack.title: Tech stack
techStack.javascript: Not bad, but I hate it

start.title: How it all started...
start.description: Started with Python like everyone else. The first real project was started from a Discord bot. I was interested and learnt how to use Discord APIs. About few years later, LLMs came out and I started making Discord chatbots. It was pretty fun.

webDev.title: Web Development
webDev.description: About the website, I always wanted to make websites but I hated pure HTML and CSS. One time our team needed to make a web app for a project, and one of my friend bring me into Next.JS. I was like, omg its good, and started to learn and use it. In 2024, I joined the development team of SITCON, then I built most of my website since then. Now I have several projects using Next.JS.

java.title: Java & Bukkit API
java.description: After starting FreeServer (please view the Server Managing & Networking part if you missed it), I waned to make a Minecraft server called FreeServer Network. I need custom plugins for the server, but I don't want to pay others to do it. So I started to learn Java and Bukkit API. I made several plugins for the server, and it was a great experience. I am still learning. You can view more in the Minecraft window.

freeserver.part1: FreeServer was a project started by me and Mayboy. Initially, I noticed my friend Mayboy using Google Cloud Platform (GCP)'s free 300 USD plan, and I wondered if we could use it for free hosting. So, we invited our friend Windless to join the project.
freeserver.part2: FreeServer provided free hosting for Minecraft servers and Discord bots. The free specs included 1 vCPU, 4 GB RAM, and 10 GB of disk space. The server was located in Taiwan. These specs were quite generous for free hosting in Asia.
freeserver.part3: The server faced a lot of DDoS traffic initially, until we met Alger Huang, the owner of Fast-Line, who offered free anti-DDoS service for us. After about 4 months, we encountered policy changes from GCP and the end of Fast-Line's free anti-DDoS service. Eventually, we decided to shut down FreeServer in August 2022.

cheapserver.part1: With the earnings from FreeServer, we decided to launch a paid server hosting service called CheapServer. This time, we brought in our friend CH to join the business.
cheapserver.part2: When CheapServer started, there were no hosting services in Taiwan that could match our low prices (as we believed). We gained customers from the beginning.
cheapserver.part3: CheapServer is still operational today. We have a growing customer base and continuously strive to improve our service.

freeserverv2.part1: After CheapServer, we missed the good old days of operating FreeServer. So, this time, we invested some money from CheapServer instead of relying on free trials from GCP to run FreeServer v2.
freeserverv2.part2: First, we purchased a VPS from Taipei 101 (one of my friends) and started the hosting. We reused the website components from FreeServer v1. However, we encountered some collaboration issues, so we switched to Hetzner as the server provider.
freeserverv2.part3: Unfortunately, we ran out of funds and became exhausted. As a result, we made the decision to shut down FreeServer v2 in July 2023.

freeserverv3.part1: During a Discord voice chat, my friend Ricky (aka Smitug) suggested reopening FreeServer. I had been considering it as well. So, we decided to relaunch it, this time using our own server infrastructure. Our goal is to make it even better than before.
freeserverv3.part2: FreeServer v3 is still in operation today. We have acquired over 7,000 users and 1,700+ active servers, and the numbers continue to grow.

minecraft.servverDescription: I actually learned most of the server mangement skills from operating these Minecraft servers. I rented some of these from server hosting providers and started thinking why whouldn't I just start a hosting company? anyway, These are the servers I created:

nelsonSMPv1.title: Nelson SMP v1
nelsonSMPv1.description: After playing some public servers, I wanted to create my own server and invite my friends to play. So I created a server on Aternos. I knew nothing about server at that time, it was just a vanilla potato server. After I learned about some hosting things, I moved the server to a server provider that the owner is a friend of mine now. But I was in junior high school and I was pretty poor, so I forgot to renew the server eventually the map was deleted. The server name was made after Nelson SMP v2 created, it didn't have a name at that time.

nelsonSMPv2.title: Nelson SMP v2
nelsonSMPv2.description: What did I do after losing the map? just create another one. This time, I invited more friends to play and it went pretty well. Normally the server has about 10 players online, there are traders, builders, etc., and we even had a war. But just like most SMP servers, it died after a while, and this time the map was preserved.

MLGRush.title: MLGRush
MLGRush.description: Aside from playing survival, I also like to play PVP servers like bedwars. There is a minigame called MLG Rush, but at the time there was barely any server not to say in asia. So I created this one and hosted it in Singapore. It was pretty fun, there was total 5000+ players joined it, but eventually I lost interest in it after a while and shut it down.

highschoolSMP.title: Highschool SMP
highschoolSMP.description: As the time going I went to high school. I found that a lot of new high school students are lack of friends both online and irl. And I saw that a lot of them are playing Minecraft. So, I created this SMP server for high school students to play and make friends. It was pretty successful, we had about 40 players online at the peak time. But just like most of my servers, it died after a while.

nelsonSMPv3.title: Nelson SMP v3
nelsonSMPv3.description: This is the most long-lived server I've ever own. After creating several servers, I went back to create a new private SMP server. This time I invited even more friends and recruited more players on facebook. I spent a lot of money renting an OVH dedicated server to run this (later on I got some money to build and host server myself, it was at that time I started my hosting business). Even this server is pure vanilla and we have ~20 players online at peak, it's quite peaceful. We built a lot of stuff on the server, as you can see in the gallery. The server actually has two seasons, which Nelson SMP v4 is in between. After SMP v4 I decided to go back to v3 because I think consistenly creating new servers is just not good. The server is still running now, but we only have ~10 active players now (the whitelist has over 100 players).

nelsonSMPv4.title: Nelson SMP v4
nelsonSMPv4.description: This server only lasted for about 3 months. We we're just get bored of the old map and fired up a new server. All players are the same from v3. After playing for a while and the builders built a lot of cool buildings, I thought it was a good idea just to go back to v3 map. The buildings were really good tho.

freeServerNetwork.title: FreeServer Network
freeServerNetwork.description: I've seen a lot of Minecraft map sharing site, and I wonder why can't I just play map inside the game? therefore, I created this server. FreeServer Network is a Minecraft server focusing on map sharing for creators. We provide a platform for creators to share their maps and for players to enjoy them. The server has a lot of custom plugins and features to enhance the experience.
